com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveFederationIf

public interface XhiveFederationIf

The federation object manages the collection of X-Hive/DB databases, and is only accessible by the super user. Each X-Hive/DB installation has only one federation. By default, the federation is created by the installer. However, you can create a federation by hand by issuing the command xhive-ant install-federation.

Warning: Creating a federation deletes all existing databases. Make backups first if applicable.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Field Detail

BACKUP_INCREMENTAL

static final int BACKUP_INCREMENTAL
Create an incremental backup. If this option is set, an incremental backup is created that includes only the log files since the last (non-standalone) backup.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

BACKUP_KEEP_LOG_FILES

static final int BACKUP_KEEP_LOG_FILES
Do not remove obsolete log files after backup. If this option is set, the backup procedure will not remove obsolete log files after the backup.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

BACKUP_STANDALONE

static final int BACKUP_STANDALONE
Create a standalone backup. A standalone backup does not interrupt the sequence of incremental backups. Incremental backups cannot be created with respect to a standalone backup. This option implies BACKUP_KEEP_LOG_FILES. Only one backup that is not standalone can be created at the same time.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUSPEND_FLUSH_CACHE

static final int SUSPEND_FLUSH_CACHE
Flush all dirty pages in the cache to disk. Option for suspendDiskWrites(int).

Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUSPEND_CHECKPOINT

static final int SUSPEND_CHECKPOINT
Take a (lightweight) checkpoint. Option for suspendDiskWrites(int). If used together with SUSPEND_FLUSH_CACHE the combination is a heavyweight checkpoint. If creating a backup while disk writes are suspended, this makes sure that redo recovery is not necessary after restoring the backup.

On a replicator, this option is ignored. Replicators cannot take independent checkpoints.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUSPEND_SYNC

static final int SUSPEND_SYNC
Flush all files to disk. Option for suspendDiskWrites(int). Useful if you use a low level backup mechanism that bypasses the operating system when copying the federation files.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

createDatabase

XhiveDatabaseIf createDatabase(java.lang.String databaseName,
                               java.lang.String dbaPassword)
Create a new database containing a single segment, the default segment (with id default). By default everything will be clustered in the default segment.

Only the super user can perform this action. No intermediate output is shown. No password policy is enforced for the administrator password. The password is encrypted.

Parameters:
databaseName - name of the new database.
dbaPassword - administrator password.
Throws:
XhiveException.DATABASE_EXISTS - when a database with databaseName already exists.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

createDatabase

XhiveDatabaseIf createDatabase(java.lang.String databaseName,
                               java.lang.String dbaPassword,
                               java.lang.String path,
                               long maxSize)
Create a new database with a custom configuration for the default segment.

Only the super user can perform this action. No intermediate output is shown. No password policy is enforced for the administrator password. The password is encrypted.

Parameters:
databaseName - name of the new database.
dbaPassword - administrator password.
path - The path to the location the default file of the default segment should be created in. If null then the file will be located in the same path as that of the default database of the federation
maxSize - The maximum size (in bytes) that the file is allowed to grow to. A value of 0 means the size is unlimited.
Returns:
The newly created database.
Throws:
XhiveException.DATABASE_EXISTS - when a database with databaseName already exists.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

createDatabase

XhiveDatabaseIf createDatabase(java.lang.String databaseName,
                               java.lang.String dbaPassword,
                               java.lang.String configFile,
                               java.io.PrintStream out)
                               throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                      java.io.IOException

Create a new database either with the default configuration or with a custom configuration.

The other two create database calls create the most basic database configuration possible (A database with only a default segment containing a default file).

This call enables you to create a non standard database configuration according to a database configuration description (see manual for more information about these). If no description is supplied a database will be created according to the default configuration. Currently the default configuration is a database with a single segment with a single file.

Only the super user can perform this action. No intermediate output is shown. No password policy is enforced for the administrator password. The password is encrypted.

Parameters:
databaseName - name of the new database.
dbaPassword - administrator password.
configFile - path to configfile, if null then the default configuration is used.
out - stream to write verbose output to, can be null if no output is wanted.
Returns:
The newly created database.
Throws:
XhiveException.DATABASE_EXISTS - when a database with databaseName already exists.
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is a problem with the configuration file.
java.io.IOException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

deleteDatabase

void deleteDatabase(java.lang.String databaseName)
Delete an existing database.

Only the administrator or super user can perform this action. Ensure that this action is handled in a dedicated transaction.

Warning: All data in the database will be lost. Make backups first if applicable.

Throws:
XhiveException.ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to delete a database.
XhiveException.DATABASE_NOT_FOUND - when the database is not found.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getDatabaseNames()
Get an iterator containing the String representation of the database names in the federation.

Only the super user can perform this action.

Returns:
An iterator of Strings.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getKeepLogFiles

boolean getKeepLogFiles()
Get the value of the keepLogFiles option. If this option is set to false, log files are removed as soon as they are no longer necessary for crash recovery or transaction rollback. This saves disk space, but does not allow creation of incremental backups. If incremental backups are desired, this option should be set to true. In this case, log files are only removed when a backup has been created.

Returns:
The current value.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

setKeepLogFiles

void setKeepLogFiles(boolean keepLogFiles)
Set the value of the keepLogFiles option.

Parameters:
keepLogFiles - The new value.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
See Also:
getKeepLogFiles()

backup

void backup(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel out,
            int options)
Create an online ("hot") backup of the federation. Can only be called if a server is running.

Parameters:
out - A channel to send the backup to.
options - A bitwise or-ed combination of BACKUP_INCREMENTAL, BACKUP_KEEP_LOG_FILES and BACKUP_STANDALONE or 0 to set no options.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
See Also:
XhiveFederationFactoryIf.restoreFederation(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel, java.lang.String, com.xhive.core.interfaces.XhiveFederationFactoryIf.PathMapper)

registerReplicator

void registerReplicator(java.lang.String id)
Register a replicator with this federation. This allows a replicator to connect to the server with the specified id. If a replicator has been registered, old server logs will not be deleted until those logs have been sent to that replicator. Therefore, do not register a replicator without actually running it or your log will fill up.

Parameters:
id - The id of the replicator that will connect.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

unregisterReplicator

void unregisterReplicator(java.lang.String id)
Unregister a replicator. Log files will no longer be preserved for this replicator.

Parameters:
id - The id of the replicator that will no longer connect.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

getReplicators

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getReplicators()
Retrieve all registered replicators.

Returns:
Iterator of java.lang.String objects with ids of replicators.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

replicateFully

void replicateFully(java.lang.String bootstrapFilename,
                    XhiveFederationFactoryIf.PathMapper mapper)
Replicate the whole federation. This only performs an initial duplication.

Parameters:
bootstrapFilename - The filename of the new bootstrap file. If null, the same path will be used as in the original federation.
mapper - An implementation of XhiveFederationFactoryIf.PathMapper. If null, the original paths will be used.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

shutdown

void shutdown(java.lang.String[] replicatorIds)
Shutdown the X-Hive/DB server. Before returning, wait for all specified replicators to be completely up to date with this server. If necessary, this will also wait for that replicator to connect.

This method can be useful if the role of the master has to be transfered to another copy, e.g. because this server has to be brought down for an upgrade. Such a transfer can only be done if the new master is completely up to date with the old one.

Parameters:
replicatorIds - The ids of the replicators that will be waited for to become up to date. Passing null is equivalent to a zero-length array.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

getRemoteConnections

java.util.List<java.net.SocketAddress> getRemoteConnections()
Finds all remote client connections to this server. This method is useful in conjunction with closeRemoteConnection(java.net.SocketAddress).

Returns:
A java.util.List with java.net.SocketAddress objects representing the remote addresses of client connections to this server.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

closeRemoteConnection

boolean closeRemoteConnection(java.net.SocketAddress address)
Close any remote connection to the server from the specified remote address. This will automatically rollback any transaction that the remote session may be executing. This method is useful if a remote client machine crashed or its network connection failed and the TCP/IP connection was not properly terminated.

Parameters:
address - The remote address of the connection to close.
Returns:
True if a connection with the specified address was found.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

suspendDiskWrites

void suspendDiskWrites(int options)
Suspend all writes to disk. Update transactions will block. Readonly transactions continue normally. While disk writes are suspended, you can create a consistent backup by copying all files of the federation. This is probably only useful if you can create such a copy quickly using a low level snapshot mechanism.

Parameters:
options - An inclusive or of SUSPEND_FLUSH_CACHE, SUSPEND_CHECKPOINT and SUSPEND_SYNC or 0 for no options.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

resumeDiskWrites

void resumeDiskWrites()
Resume disk writes when suspended. This reverses the effects of suspendDiskWrites(int), allowing disk writes and update transactions to continue.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0
